subject: Mental Health
title: A Brief History of Anxiety
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on A Brief History of Anxiety.

hook.text: Ancient Greeks called it melancholia and blamed an imbalance of black bile.

buildup.text: Freud rebranded it as neurosis, rooted in unconscious conflict.

discovery.text: By the 1980s, the DSM split anxiety into specific disorders with clear criteria.

twist.text: Soldiers returning from war forced society to take anxiety seriously as illness.

climax.text: Today, anxiety disorders are the most common mental illness worldwide.

punchline.text: It took centuries to stop calling fear a weakness.

quiz.question: Who reframed anxiety as 'neurosis' rooted in unconscious conflict?
